intro: Anthephora villosa, commonly known as the hairy anthephora, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
